definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
(of birds) to migrate south for the winter

sentences.english: A little chook was flying south for the Winter.
sentences.chinese: 一只小鸟飞到南边去过冬。

sentences.english: Birds that overwinter in your garden need to find food 365 days of the year.
sentences.chinese: 在你的院子中过冬的鸟类一年365天都需要觅食。

sentences.english: I saw a flight of geese headed south for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 我看到一群大雁南飞过冬去了。

sentences.english: If you winter there, what do you do for food and drink?
sentences.chinese: 如果在那过冬，你怎么找吃的喝的？

sentences.english: The squirrel stashes away nuts for winter.
sentences.chinese: 松鼠贮藏胡桃以备过冬。

sentences.english: Jujube also close your eyes to prepare the winter.
sentences.chinese: 枣树又闭上眼睛准备过冬了。

sentences.english: U. S. dollar had to stop for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 都知道美元在找过冬的垫背。

sentences.english: The largest flock of 3, 000 birds dependson its winter habitat on Poyang Lake.
sentences.chinese: 多达3000只的鹤群在鄱阳湖过冬。

sentences.english: Every October, white storks fly to the South to spend the winter.
sentences.chinese: 十月的时候，白鹳会陆续飞往南方过冬。

sentences.english: There once was a nonconformist bird that decided not to fly south for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 曾经有一只不墨守常规的鸟，他决定不飞往南方过冬。

sentences.english: The bear settled in for the winter in its cave.
sentences.chinese: 这头熊栖身在它的洞里过冬。

sentences.english: Was counting winter dinners, one a hill.
sentences.chinese: 正数着过冬的粮食，一堆就是一餐饭。

sentences.english: Overwintering anti early rearing of Latrodectus tredecimguttatus baby spiders is the key of artificially rearing the spiders.
sentences.chinese: 间斑寇蛛幼蛛过冬和早期饲养管理是人工饲养的关键。

sentences.english: I have a warm nest and I will stay here in the winter.
sentences.chinese: 我把窝垫得暖暖和和的，就在这儿过冬。

sentences.english: The Wehrmacht had no winter uniforms.
sentences.chinese: 纳粹国防军没有过冬的制服。

sentences.english: They winter the cows in the barn.
sentences.chinese: 他们让母牛在牲口棚里过冬。

definition: to defend against the cold/to keep warm
to escape the cold by going on a winter holiday
to pass the winter/to overwinter/to live through the winter
to warm oneself (by a fire etc)
cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
to stay warm/to protect against the cold
beginning of spring/the lunar New Year
to freeze to death/to die off in winter
